description.narrative: Seeks to address the following challenge: Influencing the fulfillment of child rights and related global development requires comprehension of the complex challenges, the underlying cause effect relations and the role of Finland as a member of the internat ional community. Without the comprehension, the general public or the decision makers are not able to advocate for the fulfillment of child rights and global responsibility.Aims to enforce global civic responsibility contributing to realization of human an d child rights. PlanCitizen provides opportunities for people to participate and get engaged. PlanCitizen consists of Children?s Board, Young adults? network and General Volunteering. Children?s Board aims at raising awareness of child rights and advocatin g for the rights of children in developing countries. The Board organises events and campaigns such as Beat the Violence. International co-operation with Vietnamese youth enforces mutual learning and exchange of information. Young adults? network motivates young adults to take action for global justice. The network is a facilitating platform for youth volunteering and youth participatory advocacy. Nationally, it advocates and raises awareness on global youth unemployment especially. The cooperation with you th group YACAN in Sierra Leone enables mutual learning on global issues, advocacy and different cultures.General Volunteering aims to increase interest in child rights and offer opportunities for civil society engagement. Volunteers participate in campaign s and organise events and exhibitions. Regional coordinators coordinate the volunteer activities around Finland. In 2013 volunteers worked on Right to learn -campaign advocating for the funding of education in development cooperation. The development impac ts and direct beneficiaries include increased awareness on child rights, development and global responsibility among children, young adults, volunteers, pupils, teachers and wider public, increased understanding on child rights and development as well as e nhanced skills on active global citizenship among PlanCitizen groups, increased capacity of volunteers to advocate for child rights and development.
